qas.question: Who enforces canon law in Catholicism?
What is the name for the collection of formal rules in Catholicism?
What does management of canon law aim to regulate?
What is canon law's purpose with respect to members of the Catholic Church?

answers.text: order and direct the activities of Catholics toward the mission of the Church

qas.question: In what church is canon law used to regulate internal organizations?
What mission this Canon law directly activities of all Christians towards?
What is the name of the collection of informal rules in Catholicism?
What law is enforced by individual parishes?

context: In the <b4_0>Catholic Church<b4_0/>, <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0>canon law<b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/> is the system of laws and legal principles made and enforced by <a0_0>the Church's hierarchical authorities<a0_0/> to regulate its <a2_0>external organization and government<a2_0/> and to <a3_0>order and direct the activities of Catholics toward <b5_0>the mission of the Church<b5_0/><a3_0/>.
